title: Could you list some useful plugins and scripts for IDA Pro? [closed]
content:
I am just starting to use IDA Pro. After discussing a bit with the community, it seems that IDA Pro plugins and scripts are quite important to reach a good level of productivity while analyzing a program.

What are some must have plugins for IDApro that you would recommend for an everyday usage.

comments.text: what kind of program? what kind of analysis? that's an extremely broad question so far.
possible duplicate of What are the essential IDA Plugins or IDA Python scripts that you use?

IMHO, most useful plugin - one You familiar with and one that automate and help in YOUR work with IDA. When You'll learn IDA a bit more, You'll find out Your methods, and then - choose Your plugins to automate process.
I converted it into a community wiki so that anyone can edit it and add a list of plugins as I think the question is very common.
I edited the question to reflect the two main tasks for which I intend to use IDApro.

answers_data.content:
Generic helpers for reverse engineering of a specific architecture.

Generic helpers for reverse engineering of a specific operating system.

Generic helpers for reverse engineering of binaries generated using a specific compiler.

Generic helpers for reverse engineering of a technology.

Generic helpers for reverse engineering of encryption and decryption algorithms.

Plugins and scripts for removing obfuscations from disassembly.

comments.text: I started with this small template. I have more that I want to add but I don't have time right now. Anyone else, edit away.
is there a reliable mirror for the mida plugin? It'd be nice if we could ensure all download links work.
